::Savanna::

She looked at Phobia. "Our history may have started the same, but it 
branched off into far different directions.  You risked your life to 
make contact with your sworn enemy.  Why? What could be that 
important to risk your existance?"
She felt like this was a lion and rat game.  And she knew who the rat 
was.  
"Why betray your own side to talk to us. Surely they know your here." 
No matter what, a traitor was a traitor.  Once a bot betrays it's own 
side, they would have no trouble doing it again.

--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, cyberwolf4@p... wrote:
> "I understand your mistrust, I may be a Predicon but our histories 
> are quite the same. distrust, destruction, and even hate has been 
in 
> our programming since the Decepticons took the first shot at an 
> ancient Autobot."
> 
> Phobia knew this wasn't easy for anyone but he had to gain thier 
> trust.The future depended on it.
>
